meanings.definition: One who unravels or untangles something.
meanings.sent1: The raveler carefully untangled the knots in the yarn.
meanings.sent2: The skilled raveler quickly fixed the tangled shoelaces.
meanings.sent3: The raveler's job was to untangle the mess of wires behind the computer.
meanings.sent4: She was a true raveler, able to unravel any puzzle thrown her way.
meanings.sent5: The raveler's nimble fingers worked magic on the knotted rope.

meanings.sent1: The raveler explored new lands every month.
meanings.sent2: As a raveler, he had visited over twenty countries.
meanings.sent3: The young raveler always had a new adventure to share.
meanings.sent4: She was a true raveler of the world, seeking new experiences at every turn.
meanings.sent5: The raveler's passport was filled with stamps from exotic destinations.

meanings.definition: A tool or device used for unraveling or untangling.
meanings.sent1: The seamstress used a small raveler to fix the loose threads.
meanings.sent2: The raveler was essential in fixing the tangled fishing line.
meanings.sent3: The old raveler had been passed down through generations.
meanings.sent4: The raveler glinted in the sunlight as it worked its magic on the knotted rope.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the raveler made untangling knots a breeze.
